verses.verse: Jesus, full of the Sacred Spirit, returned from the Jordan River and was being led in the Spirit into the backcountry
forty days as He experienced trouble under the Accuser. And He ate nothing in those days. And later, when they were totally finished, He was hungry.
The Accuser said to Him, "If You are a son of God, say to this stone that it should become bread."
And Jesus responded to him, saying, "It has been written, (in Deuteronomy 8:3) 'The person will not live on bread alone, but on every statement of God.'"
And after the Accuser led Him up into a high mountain, he showed Him all the empires of the civilized world in an instant of time.
And the Accuser said to Him, "I will give You absolutely all this authority and their magnificence because it has been turned over to me and to whomever I want to give it.
So if You bow down in my sight, all things will be Yours."
And when He responded to him, Jesus said, "Go back behind Me, Opponent. You see, it has been written, (in Deuteronomy 6:13) 'You will bow down to the Master, your God, and minister to Him only.'"
And he led Him into Jerusalem, stood Him on the wing of the temple grounds, and said to Him, "If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here.
You see, it has been written, (in Psalm 91:11-12) 'He will demand His angels concerning you for the purpose to guard you closely."
And they will pick you up on hands so that you will never stub your foot close to a stone.'"
And when He answered, Jesus said to him, "It has been stated, (in Deuteronomy 6:16) 'You will not try to cause trouble for the Master, your God.'"
And after the Accuser totally finished every trouble, he stayed away from Him till another time.
And Jesus returned in the ability of the Spirit into Galilee, and comments went throughout the whole surrounding rural area about Him.
And He was teaching in their synagogues, being made magnificent by everyone.
And He went into Nazareth where it was that He had been nurtured, and He went (according to what had been a custom for Him during the day of the Sabbaths) into the synagogue and stood up to read.
And a scroll of the preacher Isaiah was given over to Him. And when He unrolled the scroll, He found the place (in Isaiah 61:1-2) where it was that it had been written,

"The Master's Spirit is on Me, on account of which He anointed Me to share good news with poor people. He has sent Me out on a mission to cure the people whose heart has been crushed, to speak publicly to incarcerated people about forgiveness and about seeing again to blind people, to send people out in forgiveness who have been broken into pieces,
to speak publicly about the accepted year of the Master."
And when He rolled up the scroll, after He gave it back to the rower, He was seated. And the eyes of everyone in the synagogue were staring at Him.
He began to be saying to them, "Today, this writing has been accomplished in your ears."

And all were telling what they witnessed of Him and being amazed based on the messages of the generosity, the messages traveling out of His mouth. And they were saying, "Isn't this the son of Joseph?"
And He said to them, "By all means, you will state this illustration to Me, 'Doctor, heal yourself. As many things as we heard happened in Capernaum, do also here in your hometown.'"
He said, "Amen, I tell you that not even one preacher is accepted in his hometown.
But it is based on truth, I tell you. There were many widows in the days of Elijah in Israel when he closed the sky over three years and six months as a huge famine happened on the entire earth.
And to not even one of them was Elijah sent except to Sarepta of Sidon, toward a woman, a widow.
And there were many skin-diseased people over the time of Elisha, the preacher, in Israel and not even one of them was cleared up except Naaman, the Syrian.
And everyone was filled with anger in the synagogue hearing these things.
And when they stood up, they threw Him outside of the city and led Him up to the overhang of the mountain on which their city had been built for the "to throw Him down the steep slope" part.
But He, after going through the middle of them, was traveling off.
And He went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and was teaching them on the Sabbaths.
And they were being impressed based on His teaching because His message was with authority.
And in the synagogue, there was a person who had the spirit of a demon that was not clean, and he yelled out with a loud voice,
saying, "Ahhhh! What is there between us and You, Jesus, Nazarene? Did you come to ruin us? I know who You are, the Sacred One of God."
And Jesus forbid him, saying, "Be quiet and come out of him." And after the demon tossed him into the middle, he came out from him after not hurting him.

And bewilderment happened on everyone, and they were speaking together to each other, saying, "What is this saying? Because with authority and ability He gives directives to the spirits that are not clean, and they come out."
And a reverberation about Him was traveling out into every place of the surrounding rural area.
When He got up from the synagogue, He went into the house of Simon. Simon's mother-in-law was being constrained by a huge fever, and they asked Him about her.
And when He stood over her, He forbid the fever, and it left her. At once, after standing up, she was serving them.
As the sun was setting, everyone, as many as had people who were weak with various illnesses led them to Him. Jesus, after placing His hands on each one of them, healed them.

Demons were also coming out of many, yelling and saying, "You are the Anointed King, the Son of God." And forbidding them, He was not allowing them to be speaking because they knew Him to be the Anointed King.

When it became day, after going out, He traveled into an uninhabited place. And the crowds were looking for Him and went until they found Him. And they were holding Him up for the purpose to not be traveling off from them.
Jesus said to them, "It is necessary for Me to share the good news of the empire of God also with different cities, because I have been sent out on a mission for this."
And He was speaking publicly in the synagogues of Galilee.
